name: Tiger Cat
description: Tiger cats, often referred to as mackerel tabbies, have narrow stripes running parallel down their sides. They are outgoing and friendly.
fun_facts: Their striped pattern resembles that of a tiger.
They are known for their playful nature.
Not a distinct breed but a common coat pattern.

name: Tabby Cat
description: Tabby cats are known for their distinctive 'M' forehead marking and various coat patterns. They are friendly, affectionate, and excellent hunters.
fun_facts: Tabby is a coat pattern found in many breeds.
They often have a strong hunting instinct.
The 'M' marking on their forehead is a signature trait.

name: Persian Cat
description: Persian cats have long, luxurious coats and a calm demeanor. They are affectionate and prefer serene environments.
fun_facts: One of the oldest cat breeds.
Require regular grooming due to their long fur.
Known for their expressive eyes and flat faces.

name: Siamese Cat
description: Siamese cats are social, intelligent, and vocal. They have a sleek body, blue almond-shaped eyes, and point coloration.
fun_facts: They often 'talk' with their owners.
One of the oldest and most recognizable breeds.
Their coat color is temperature-sensitive.

name: Egyptian Mau
description: Egyptian Maus are the only naturally spotted domestic cat breed. They are loyal, intelligent, and have a unique skin flap for agility.
fun_facts: Can run up to 30 mph, making them the fastest domestic cat.
Often form strong bonds with a single person.
Their spots are unique to each individual.

name: Cougar
description: Also known as mountain lions or pumas, cougars are large wild cats found throughout the Americas.
fun_facts: Can leap up to 18 feet vertically.
Silent hunters, rarely vocal.
They are the second heaviest big cat in the Americas after the jaguar.

name: Lynx
description: Lynxes are medium-sized wild cats with tufted ears and short tails, known for their stealth.
fun_facts: Have large paws that act like snowshoes.
Ear tufts help with hearing.
They are excellent climbers and swimmers.

name: Leopard
description: Leopards are powerful and agile big cats known for their rosette-spotted coats and stealthy hunting.
fun_facts: Can carry prey heavier than themselves into trees.
Excellent swimmers.
Often confused with jaguars.

name: Snow Leopard
description: Snow leopards are elusive big cats adapted to cold mountainous environments with long tails and thick fur.
fun_facts: Known as 'ghosts of the mountains.'
Thick fur and long tails help them survive in freezing climates.
Rarely seen in the wild.

name: Jaguar
description: Jaguars are robust big cats with a powerful bite, usually found in rainforests and swamps.
fun_facts: Have the strongest bite force of any big cat.
Often hunt in water.
Rosettes on their coat have central spots (unlike leopards).

name: Lion
description: Lions are the only social big cats, living in prides. Males have manes and females are the primary hunters.
fun_facts: Roars can be heard up to 5 miles away.
Lions rest up to 20 hours a day.
Female lions do most of the hunting.

name: Cheetah
description: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, capable of reaching speeds up to 60-70 mph in short bursts.
fun_facts: Non-retractable claws help with traction.
Cannot roar but make chirping sounds.
Have 'tear marks' under eyes for reducing glare.

name: Tiger
description: Tigers are the largest wild cats, known for their striped coats and powerful builds.
fun_facts: Each tiger's stripes are unique.
Good swimmers and often bathe in rivers.
Roars can be heard 2 miles away.
